metadata.title: CVE-2022-20008 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In mmc_blk_read_single of block.c, there is a possible way to read kernelheap memory due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local informationdisclosure if reading from an SD card that triggers errors, with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-216481035References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
